jobs.title: AI Research - Scientist/ Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient

Sentient is building the world’s first open and community-built AGI platform — an open-source intelligence network designed to rival and complement closed systems such as OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google. Our mission is simple yet bold: to make open-source AI win.

Sentient is already a research powerhouse, delivering breakthroughs that outperform leading closed-source labs across benchmarks and applications:

  • GRID – the backbone network of agents, models, and data driving cutting-edge research and powering applications.

  • Sentient Chat – consumer gateway to the GRID, with 2M+ users on the waitlist.

  • Dobby LLMs – open-source model family embedding human-like values at scale; ranked #1 on the UGI benchmark with the largest personality layer in AI.

  • Open Deep Search (ODS) – open-source AI search framework with a 75.3% FRAMES score, surpassing GPT-4o (~65%) and Perplexity (~45%).

  • ROMA – multi-agent routing framework; #1 on GitHub, outperforming Gemini 2.5 Pro and Kimi.

  • Model Fingerprinting – first cryptographic framework for verifiable model ownership.

Backed by $85M in seed funding co-led by Founders Fund, Pantera Capital, and Framework Ventures, with support from Franklin Templeton, Naval Ravikant, Balaji Srinivasan, Symbolic Capital, IDG, and others, Sentient is uniquely positioned to lead the future of open-source AGI.

About the role:

As a Research Scientist/Engineer on the AI team at Sentient, you'll lead the development and implementation of techniques aimed at training language models and agents that have advanced reasoning capabilities: In particular, such AI will be able to make strategic decisions in multi-agent environments with high stakes (e.g., involving financial transactions), You'll work to develop novel post training and agentic techniques and to use these to demonstrably improve AI behavior.

Take a look at the following to get a feel for the kind of work we do at Sentient.

  1. Agentic frameworks: https://github.com/sentient-agi/ROMA and https://github.com/sentient-agi/OpenDeepSearch

  2. Post training models: https://www.alphaxiv.org/abs/2025.01v1 and https://arxiv.org/pdf/2503.16248

  3. Benchmarks: https://spinbench.github.io/index.html and https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.11928

Working Environment:

We are looking for multiple full time and intern positions. This is a work from home position with periodic in-person meetings in the US east coast and west coasts. You will work with other researchers at Sentient including Sewoong Oh (Professor, UW-Seattle) and Pramod Viswanath (Professor, Princeton).

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement novel fine-tuning and reinforcement learning techniques using synthetic data generated from multi-turn interactions.

  • Use these to design agentic systems to improve reasoning skills to be evaluated on long-horizon strategic decision making benchmarks.

  • Create and maintain evaluation frameworks to measure reasoning skills and design new benchmarks.

You may be a good fit if you:

  • Have an MS/PhD in Computer Science, ML, or related field, or equivalent experience

  • Possess strong programming skills, especially in Python

  • Have experience with ML model training and experimentation

  • Have a track record of implementing ML research

  • Demonstrate strong analytical skills for interpreting experimental results

  • Have experience with ML metrics and evaluation frameworks

  • Excel at turning research ideas into working code

  • Can identify and resolve practical implementation challenges

Strong candidates may also have:

  • Experience with language model fine-tuning and post-training

  • Background in AI agents and/or reasoning research

  • Published work in AI

  • Experience with synthetic data generation

  • Familiarity with techniques like RLHF and reward modeling

  • Track record of designing and implementing novel training approaches

  • Experience with model behavior evaluation and improvement

Education requirements: We require at least a masters degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

YOU MAY BE A GOOD FIT IF YOU:

 - Have an MS/PhD in Computer Science, ML, or related field, or equivalent experience

 - Possess strong programming skills, especially in Python

 - Have experience with ML model training and experimentation

 - Have a track record of implementing ML research

 - Demonstrate strong analytical skills for interpreting experimental results

 - Have experience with ML metrics and evaluation frameworks

 - Excel at turning research ideas into working code

 - Can identify and resolve practical implementation challenges


STRONG CANDIDATES MAY ALSO HAVE:

 - Experience with language model fine-tuning and post-training

 - Background in AI agents and/or reasoning research

 - Published work in AI

 - Experience with synthetic data generation

 - Familiarity with techniques like RLHF and reward modeling

 - Track record of designing and implementing novel training approaches

 - Experience with model behavior evaluation and improvement

Education requirements: We require at least a masters degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

jobs.title: Developer Relations & Ecosystem Growth Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Your Role

As our first Developer Relations & Ecosystem Growth Lead, you’ll own and grow our developer community and experience from the ground up. If you’re excited about being the bridge between breakthrough AI infrastructure and the developers building the next generation of LLM agents, open-source tooling, and decentralized AI systems, this is your role.

You’ll wear multiple hats: advocate, educator, community architect, content creator, and ecosystem strategist. You’ll inspire and empower developers to build with Sentient’s platform, while ensuring their feedback and needs are tightly looped into our product, research, and protocol design.

This is a zero-to-one role, ideally suited for someone who’s technical, entrepreneurial, and passionate about working in the open, someone who wants to define how AI devs interact with an entirely new stack.

Your Responsibilities

Developer Community & Ecosystem Growth

  • Define and lead our developer relations strategy, from positioning to execution in partnership with founders and product leads.

  • Build and engage a global developer community across GitHub, Discord, Twitter/X, Stack Overflow, and beyond.

  • Foster an inclusive, curious, and ambitious builder culture around Sentient’s open-source initiatives and APIs.

Developer Experience & Support

  • Own the developer journey: from first contact to successful integration and ongoing contribution.

  • Respond to questions, troubleshoot issues, and guide early adopters through onboarding, SDKs, and technical integrations.

  • Collect feedback from developers and relay it to product and engineering to shape roadmap decisions.

Content & Education

  • Write clear, helpful technical documentation, tutorials, and API guides.

  • Build sample projects and demos to showcase use cases and inspire innovation.

  • Share insights through blog posts, livestreams, podcasts, talks, and community forums.

External Representation & Evangelism

  • Represent Sentient at conferences, meetups, online events, and hackathons.

  • Grow Sentient’s developer voice and visibility by “building in public” and contributing to the open-source AI conversation.

  • Encourage and support contributions to our public repos and tools.

Infrastructure & Team-Building

  • Shape the foundations of DevRel at Sentient, including tooling, KPIs, and community architecture.

  • As we scale, help hire and lead a growing DevRel team (e.g., advocates, community managers, technical writers).

What You’ll Need

  • 5+ years experience in Developer Relations, Technical Advocacy, or developer-focused Product/Community roles.

  • Strong technical fluency, you’ve worked with AI/ML tooling, trained models, or built with APIs and open-source systems.

  • Solid coding ability (e.g. Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, or similar); capable of building demos, debugging issues, and contributing to repos.

  • Experience launching or scaling developer ecosystems, especially around APIs, SDKs, or platforms.
    A natural educator and communicator, you can write great docs, explain complex concepts, and make devs feel seen.

  • Strong community instincts, you’ve been a forum moderator, GitHub maintainer, Discord admin, or just someone who shows up for the devs.

  • High ownership and bias for action, you see a need, you build the solution.

  • Deep belief in open-source AI and a decentralized future for intelligence.

Preferred

  • Experience contributing to or maintaining open-source projects in the AI space.

  • Background in LLM infrastructure, agent frameworks, or training/inference pipelines.

  • Familiarity with modern AI stacks (e.g., LangChain, Transformers, Hugging Face, BentoML, etc.).

  • Prior experience launching ambassador programs, grants, or community onboarding pipelines.

  • Public speaking experience or a history of creating dev-facing content that’s actually useful.

 - Public speaking experience or a history of creating dev-facing content that’s actually useful.

jobs.title: Director: Talent and Culture
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Your Role

As Director: Talent & Culture, you’ll be the architect of how talent shows up at Sentient, designing and owning our hiring engine, culture-building practices, and performance infrastructure from the ground up. This is a hands-on, high-impact role ideal for a talent operator who can both recruit world-class technical talent and build the systems that help them thrive.

You’ll work directly with the cofounders and early team to shape how Sentient grows, setting the bar for who we hire, how we collaborate, and what it means to build a generational company in a frontier space. You should be excited to move quickly, iterate often, and drive quality and cultural integrity at every touchpoint.

Your Responsibilities

  • Own full-cycle recruiting across technical, research, and operational roles, from sourcing to closing.

  • Design and implement scalable hiring processes, tools, and candidate experiences aligned with our mission and values.

  • Partner with founders and team leads to define hiring plans, role design, and organizational structure.

  • Build and embed foundational culture practices, including onboarding, rituals, internal comms, and team norms.

  • Develop and maintain lightweight performance and feedback systems to support high trust and high autonomy.

  • Track key hiring and people metrics to drive continuous improvement and hiring efficiency.

  • Support leadership with org design, compensation planning, leveling frameworks, and succession planning.

  • Champion diversity, transparency, and long-term thinking across all talent-related decisions.

What You’ll Need

  • 6–10 years of experience across recruiting, talent operations, or people leadership, ideally in early-stage startups.

  • Proven success hiring for hard-to-fill technical and leadership roles in high-velocity environments.

  • Strong operational ability with experience implementing systems for performance, leveling, and development.

  • Exceptional stakeholder management skills and the ability to influence cross-functional leadership.

  • Systems thinker with the ability to turn ambiguity into structure and move from zero to one.

  • Deep alignment with Sentient’s mission and a high-integrity approach to organizational building.

Preferred

  • Background in AI, frontier tech, or open-source ecosystems.

  • Experience working in remote-first, distributed, or asynchronous teams.

  • Familiarity with tools like Greenhouse, Ashby, Lattice, or similar platforms.

  • Prior experience designing or implementing equity, compensation, or incentive systems.

  • Passion for decentralization, open collaboration, and building durable organizations.

jobs.title: Design Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Your Role

As the Design Lead at Sentient Labs, you will define and drive the vision for design across our product and brand ecosystem, from high-level strategy to hands-on delivery. You will unify multiple product experiences into a coherent design language while dramatically increasing design velocity. This is a high-autonomy role, reporting directly to senior leadership, where you will be empowered to make impactful design decisions that shape the future of the Sentient technology stack and community experience.

Your Responsibilities

  • Lead design strategy and execution across product, brand, and marketing, ensuring coherence across user journeys, dashboards, developer tools, and community touchpoints.

  • Establish and own a cohesive design system that serves as a single source of truth for product, marketing, and engineering teams.

  • Translate brand vision into engaging product experiences that align with Sentient Labs’ mission and roadmap.

  • Design key flows, UI components, and visual assets hands-on, balancing high-quality delivery with speed.

  • Guide and mentor internal designers, and manage external creative collaborators to maintain quality and consistency

  • Integrate brand identity seamlessly into the product experience, not just marketing collateral.

  • Identify and resolve design process bottlenecks to improve output without sacrificing quality.

What You’ll Need

  • Proven experience leading both product and brand design in technology companies.

  • Strong hands-on skills in UI/UX, interaction design, and visual design.

  • Experience creating and scaling design systems.

  • Ability to manage internal teams and external collaborators with a focus on delivery and quality.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve complex user experience challenges.

  • Excellent communication skills and leadership presence.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Background in consumer or Web2 design leadership, with exposure to AI, blockchain, fintech, or developer platforms.

  • Experience designing dashboards, data-rich products, or multi-product ecosystems.

  • Recognized thought leadership or strong online design presence.

jobs.title: Director of Operations/Strategy
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Summary:

The director of ops/strategy strategic and operational leader, supporting the cofounder in driving company-wide planning, cross-functional coordination, and executive-level initiatives. This role focuses on adding structure, managing processes, and ensuring alignment across teams to achieve company goals. The director of ops/strategy will also act as a key representative of the Sentient cofounder, guiding informed decisions, writing on their behalf, and fostering a culture of trust and collaboration.

Responsibilities:

Strategic Planning & Execution

  • Lead annual and quarterly planning, ensuring all teams are aligned with strategic goals.

  • Track and monitor goals/roadmaps to ensure alignment with Sentient mission & strategy.

  • Facilitate cross-functional coordination, resolving dependencies and bottlenecks.

  • Collaborate with department heads to drive execution and accountability.

  • Be a positive force for operational excellence, improving company and cross-functional velocity through collaboration, communication and process.

Executive Support & Communication

  • Prepare cofounder for strategy, operation and finance meetings, offering market and partner context, data + insights and key talking points.

  • Represent the cofounder in meetings, ensuring their voice/perspective is accurately reflected.

  • Draft communications and documents on behalf of the cofounder, maintaining consistency in tone and messaging.

  • Support the cofounder in making real-time decisions to move projects forward efficiently.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in operations, strategy, business development, investment banking or a similar role, preferably in a high-growth environment

  • MBA / Investment Banking / Consulting experience is a plus

  • Strong track record of leading cross-functional initiatives and company-wide planning.

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills,

  • Excellent judgment, decision-making skills, and the ability to build consensus.

  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

  • Understanding of open source software and artificial intelligence is a plus

 - Understanding of open source software and artificial intelligence is a plus

jobs.title: APAC Ecosystem Partnerships
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient

At Sentient, we’re pioneering the decentralized artificial general intelligence (AGI) frontier, breaking free from the constraints of centralized AI models. Our cutting-edge platform is designed to democratize AI development, empowering communities to collaboratively train and control AI models in a truly open and accessible ecosystem.

Fueled by our expertise in distributed systems, cryptography, and AI, we’re building a game-changing environment that fosters open-source development and ensures fair value distribution. Say goodbye to the monopolies of the past – Sentient’s decentralized network promotes model composability and adherence to our foundational principles of transparency, trust, and inclusivity.

Imagine being part of a team that’s shaping the future of AGI, where innovation knows no boundaries, and the collective intelligence of global communities drives progress. Join us on this exhilarating journey as we redefine the AI landscape, unleashing the full potential of trustless, decentralized AGI.

Sentient is backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capital firms including Founders’ Fund, Pantera, and Framework.

What you'll do

  • Serve as the ecosystem growth lead for a new open intelligence layer of the internet. Develop the strategy for go to market, work closely with the executive team on establishing KPIs and OKRs

  • Steward the development and successful implementation of acquisition funnels, demonstrating continuous adaptation to the rapidly expanding scope of the ecosystem.

  • Design and implement growth strategies. Facilitate dynamic and meaningful conversations within the community, creating a robust and collaborative environment that fosters growth and innovation.

  • Work closely with marketing and business development teams to strategically drive ecosystem expansion and boost community engagement and awareness.

  • Help oversee daily operations within the ecosystem, ensuring smooth coordination of activities and efficient use of resources. Contribute to the development of strategic plans for adoption, integrating insights from multiple sources to create effective and forward-thinking strategies.

Qualifications

  • Have strong relationships with various protocols within the Web3 and AI space.

  • Educational background in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields, with a deep understanding of blockchain and AI technologies.

  • Proven track record in pre/alpha product-stage GTM, preferably in a rapidly evolving industry.

  • Demonstrated ability to work with developers, with a deep empathy for their needs and challenges.

  • High self-motivation, and ideally having founder experience

  • Comfortable working in an applied research environment, capable of managing high autonomy and navigating unpredictable timelines.

jobs.title: Security Research Fellow
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About https://www.sentient.xyz/

At Sentient, we’re building AI products, bringing together AI research leaders, and designing an incentive system for AI developers to make open-source AI win. Our platform is designed to democratize AI development, empowering communities to collaboratively create, monetize, and build on top of AI models, agents, and data in a truly open and accessible ecosystem, ensuring fair value distribution to AI builders.

Sentient is backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capital firms including Founders’ Fund and founded by top AI academics and protocol founders.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Security Research Fellow to join Sentient Labs and work at the intersection of cryptography, hardware security, and open-source AI. This part-time or full-time role is designed for students (undergraduate, master’s, or PhD) who are excited to dive deep into Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) and contribute to the Sentient Enclaves Framework—our TEE stack for confidential inference and trustless AI evaluation.

As a fellow, you will gain hands-on engineering experience, collaborate on real-world evaluations of TEEs, and become a subject-matter expert through original research and publications in the area of confidential computing.

Responsibilities

  • Help engineer core components of the Sentient Enclaves Framework (SEF)

https://github.com/sentient-agi/Sentient-Enclaves-Framework

  • Run benchmarking and evaluation pipelines to measure TEE performance and compare with alternative TEE offerings

  • Collaborate with Sentient researchers to design trustless evaluation protocols for open-source AI models and contributions.

  • Publish academic papers and technical reports in the field of TEEs, confidential AI, and secure AI governance.

  • Contribute to Sentient’s open-source ecosystem, documenting findings and presenting results to the broader community.

Required Qualifications

  • Enrolled in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Cryptography, or related fields.

  • Strong academic background in systems, security, or hardware (e.g., operating systems, computer architecture, or applied cryptography).

  • Working knowledge of Rust (preferred) or systems programming languages such as C/C++.

  • Familiarity with at least one TEE technology (Intel SGX, AMD SEV-SNP, Intel TDX, AWS Nitro, NVIDIA GPU-TEE).

  • Prior research experience or publications in security, cryptography, or confidential computing is a plus.

  • Self-driven, able to balance coursework with meaningful contributions to a pioneering open-source AI project.

Values

  • Appreciate and pursue deep expertise

  • Embrace extreme ownership and bias for action

  • Want to take risks and act upon ambition with integrity and empathy

  • Pursue relentless innovation and experimentation

  • Invest in personal growth and team collaboration

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Top-of-the-line engineers and technology

  • Opportunity to shape the direction of a pioneering open AI platform

Individuals seeking employment at Sentient are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT HTTPS://WWW.SENTIENT.XYZ/

At Sentient, we’re building AI products, bringing together AI research leaders, and designing an incentive system for AI developers to make open-source AI win. Our platform is designed to democratize AI development, empowering communities to collaboratively create, monetize, and build on top of AI models, agents, and data in a truly open and accessible ecosystem, ensuring fair value distribution to AI builders.

Sentient is backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capital firms including Founders’ Fund and founded by top AI academics and protocol founders.


ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking a Security Research Fellow to join Sentient Labs and work at the intersection of cryptography, hardware security, and open-source AI. This part-time or full-time role is designed for students (undergraduate, master’s, or PhD) who are excited to dive deep into Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) and contribute to the Sentient Enclaves Framework—our TEE stack for confidential inference and trustless AI evaluation.

As a fellow, you will gain hands-on engineering experience, collaborate on real-world evaluations of TEEs, and become a subject-matter expert through original research and publications in the area of confidential computing.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Help engineer core components of the Sentient Enclaves Framework (SEF)

https://github.com/sentient-agi/Sentient-Enclaves-Framework

 - Run benchmarking and evaluation pipelines to measure TEE performance and compare with alternative TEE offerings

 - Collaborate with Sentient researchers to design trustless evaluation protocols for open-source AI models and contributions.

 - Publish academic papers and technical reports in the field of TEEs, confidential AI, and secure AI governance.

 - Contribute to Sentient’s open-source ecosystem, documenting findings and presenting results to the broader community.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

 - Enrolled in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Cryptography, or related fields.

 - Strong academic background in systems, security, or hardware (e.g., operating systems, computer architecture, or applied cryptography).

 - Working knowledge of Rust (preferred) or systems programming languages such as C/C++.

 - Familiarity with at least one TEE technology (Intel SGX, AMD SEV-SNP, Intel TDX, AWS Nitro, NVIDIA GPU-TEE).

 - Prior research experience or publications in security, cryptography, or confidential computing is a plus.

 - Self-driven, able to balance coursework with meaningful contributions to a pioneering open-source AI project.


VALUES

 - Appreciate and pursue deep expertise

 - Embrace extreme ownership and bias for action

 - Want to take risks and act upon ambition with integrity and empathy

 - Pursue relentless innovation and experimentation

 - Invest in personal growth and team collaboration


BENEFITS

 - Competitive salary

 - Top-of-the-line engineers and technology

 - Opportunity to shape the direction of a pioneering open AI platform

Individuals seeking employment at Sentient are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

jobs.title: China GTM & Business Development Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Overview

We are seeking a China GTM & Business Development Manager to drive Sentient’s entry, growth, and leadership in China. This role is central to executing a market-specific go-to-market strategy, building high-impact partnerships, and establishing Sentient as a premier decentralized AI project in one of the most advanced tech markets in the world.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and implement a comprehensive China-specific GTM strategy to achieve ecosystem penetration, developer adoption, and enterprise partnerships.

  • Localize Sentient’s narrative, messaging, and campaigns for Chinese cultural, regulatory, and industry contexts.

  • Identify, prioritize, and close strategic partnerships across enterprises, research institutions, and protocols.

  • Build long-term relationships with Chinese AI/tech enterprises, universities, and policy bodies.

  • Represent Sentient at industry events, policy forums, and conferences in China.

  • Partner with local media, KOLs, influencers, and developer groups to drive awareness and adoption.

  • Lead community-facing initiatives (meetups, hackathons, joint research pilots) to accelerate grassroots traction.

  • Monitor and analyze local industry trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory shifts to guide Sentient’s China strategy.

  • Act as the bridge between the Chinese ecosystem and Sentient’s global team, ensuring local insights inform global product, ecosystem, and governance roadmaps.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of BD, partnerships, or GTM experience in China within AI, Web3, blockchain, or deep tech.

  • Proven track record of executing enterprise deals and market-entry strategies.

  • Strong existing network across Chinese enterprises, academic institutions, Web3 protocols, and regulators.

  • Fluent in Mandarin and English, with excellent communication and negotiation skills.

  • Deep understanding of China’s AI, blockchain, and regulatory landscape.

  • Entrepreneurial, metrics-driven mindset; thrives in fast-paced, high-autonomy environments.

  • Prior experience at pre/alpha product-stage launches a strong plus.

 - Deep understanding of China’s AI, blockchain, and regulatory landscape.

 - Entrepreneurial, metrics-driven mindset; thrives in fast-paced, high-autonomy environments.

 - Prior experience at pre/alpha product-stage launches a strong plus.

jobs.title: EA (Founders)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient:

At Sentient, we're pioneering open-source AGI, liberating AI development from centralized constraints. Our platform empowers global communities to collaboratively train, control, and innovate AI models in a transparent, accessible ecosystem. Backed by top Silicon Valley VCs like Founders Fund, Pantera, and Framework, and founded by leading AI academics and protocol experts, we're building distributed systems that foster true open-source progress.

About the role:

As Executive Assistant to the Founders and team of Sentient, you will serve as a critical strategic partner supporting leaders building the future of decentralized AGI. In this highly dynamic and fast-paced role, you will help bring clarity to complexity, ensure the founders’ time is aligned with Sentient’s highest priorities, and act as a trusted liaison across teams, investors, and external collaborators. Beyond direct support to the founders, you will also provide operational support to the broader Sentient team, ensuring smooth coordination and execution across the organization.

Your Responsibilities

  • Manage and optimize highly complex calendars across multiple time zones, balancing internal priorities, investor relations, and external ecosystem engagements.

  • Serve as a key point of contact for internal and external communications, triaging and following up to drive timely decision-making.

  • Coordinate global travel logistics, including flights, accommodations, ground transportation, and visa requirements.

  • Ensure seamless execution of conferences, summits, and public speaking engagements, working closely with PR, marketing, and events teams.

  • Partner with the founders to align on priorities, investor meetings, and strategic cross-functional initiatives.

  • Provide additional operational and administrative support to the broader Sentient team, helping ensure projects and deliverables run smoothly.

  • Synchronize schedules and coordinate with executive assistants and other support staff to ensure holistic planning and execution.

What You’ll Need

  • 3+ years of experience directly supporting a C-level executive or founder, preferably in a startup or high-growth environment.

  • 1+ years of experience in Web3, crypto, or AI, with working knowledge of blockchain technology and ecosystems.

  • Proven ability to operate autonomously, exercise sound judgment, and handle highly confidential information with discretion.

  • Exceptional organizational skills, prioritization, and attention to detail in high-pressure settings.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • Proficiency with productivity tools such as Notion, Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and scheduling platforms.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience supporting a founder or CEO in a tech or early-stage company.

  • Familiarity with investor relations, fundraising processes, and high-level stakeholder management.

  • High EQ and interpersonal fluency across diverse, global teams.

  • Adept at anticipating needs, solving problems, and staying two steps ahead in fluid, fast-moving environments.

jobs.title: Director: Security
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

We are seeking a highly experienced Director: Security to lead the design, implementation, and governance of security across our AI and Crypto platforms. This role will ensure that our company’s infrastructure, AI models, blockchain systems, backend infra, front end and customer data are safeguarded against evolving cyber threats. You will oversee both information security (Infosec) and crypto-native security, working closely with engineering, product, compliance, and legal teams.

Key Responsibilities

Security Leadership & Strategy

  • Define and implement the company’s security strategy across AI, blockchain, and cloud environments.

  • Establish policies, standards, and governance frameworks aligned with industry best practices (ISO 27001, NIST, SOC2).

  • Lead incident response, risk assessment, and threat modeling programs.

  • Build and mentor a world-class security team.

AI & Data Security

  • Protect proprietary AI models, training data, and pipelines from data poisoning, model theft, or adversarial attacks.

  • Secure ML infrastructure across data collection, preprocessing, model training, and deployment.

  • Implement privacy-preserving techniques (e.g., encryption, anonymization, federated learning).

Crypto & Blockchain Security

  • Oversee smart contract security audits, testing, and deployment pipelines.

  • Protect user assets across wallets, custody solutions, and crypto exchange mechanisms.

  • Monitor on-chain activity for suspicious behavior (rug pulls, flash loan attacks, etc.).

  • Partner with external firms for protocol audits, bug bounty programs, and penetration testing.

Infrastructure & Application Security

  • Implement best practices in cloud security (AWS, GCP, Azure), container security, and zero-trust networks.

  • Harden DevSecOps pipelines to ensure secure software delivery.

  • Work with engineering teams to integrate security by design into products.

Compliance & Risk Management

  • Ensure regulatory compliance with GDPR, SOC2, ISO, PCI-DSS, and crypto-specific frameworks.

  • Lead risk assessments for third-party vendors and service providers.

  • Collaborate with legal and compliance teams on KYC/AML security for crypto services.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of security leadership experience, with at least 5+ in fintech, crypto, or AI-driven environments.

  • Proven track record in cybersecurity strategy, team leadership, and incident management.

  • Deep knowledge of blockchain protocols, smart contracts (Solidity, Rust), cryptography, and custody systems.

  • Strong expertise in cloud security, DevSecOps, and secure software development lifecycle (SSDLC).

  • Understanding of AI/ML systems security, including model attacks and data integrity risks.

  • Certifications preferred: CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, OSCP, CCSK, or blockchain security certs.

jobs.title: General Counsel
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient:

At Sentient, we're pioneering open-source AGI, liberating AI development from centralized constraints. Our platform empowers global communities to collaboratively train, control, and innovate AI models in a transparent, accessible ecosystem. Backed by top Silicon Valley VCs like Founders Fund, Pantera, and Framework, and founded by leading AI academics and protocol experts, we're building distributed systems that foster true open-source progress.

Your Role

General Counsel at Sentient will be a one-person team, comfortable with getting their hands dirty to review contracts, grants, legal agreements, commercial agreements, etc. This hands-on role demands a proactive corporate lawyer who thrives on managing day-to-day operations, ensuring multi-jurisdictional compliance, and collaborating closely with cofounders and cross-functional teams..

Your Responsibilities

  • Work closely as an advisor to the business on all legal matters, especially on corporate matters and certain product questions, including negotiating contracts with collaborators and vendors.

  • Draft and negotiate bespoke, first-of-their kind agreements for Sentient products and collaborations within the space.

  • Provide legal guidance to operating entities, including advice on product development and compliance as well as corporate governance and operational best practices.

  • Develop and drive legal contracting processes and workflows.

  • Manage outside counsel efficiently and effectively where they are engaged in connecting with high profile and other projects, while maintaining domain expertise.

  • Ensure legal compliance in multiple jurisdictions, collaborating with external counsel (e.g., termination notices, General Release forms).

  • Implement policies and manage record retention across departments.

  • Support commercial and financial agreements, including BD deals, contractor agreements, and advisor fees.

What you’ll need

  • J.D. degree from a top tier law school and admission to at least one state bar

  • 4-8 years of experience at a reputable law firm and/or in-house

  • Superior negotiation and drafting skills, as well as deep knowledge of contract terms

  • Strong skills in drafting and reviewing contracts and managing compliance across multiple regions.

  • Excellent academic credentials and references

  • Ability to work cross-functionally with various internal teams, and external stakeholders.

  • Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail.

  • Excellent judgment and decision-making skills, and the ability to interact productively with other attorneys and staff, in-house client groups and outside counsel

  • M&A background is a plus

  • Understanding of open source AI space is a plus

jobs.title: Director of Strategic Partnerships for Capital Markets
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a Director of Institutional Partnerships & Capital Markets to lead Sentient’s institutional adoption and capital markets initiatives. This is a senior leadership role at the intersection of AI, blockchain, and traditional finance. The mandate spans fundraising from major institutions and funds, developing capital markets products, and building the infrastructure for Sentient to engage with global financial institutions, including future opportunities such as ETFs, listed products, and large-scale partnerships.The ideal candidate brings a TradFi pedigree and crypto-native conviction, with a proven track record of bridging institutional capital, regulated markets, and frontier technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Institutional Capital Formation: Lead fundraising efforts with institutional allocators, sovereign wealth funds, pension funds, hedge funds, and VCs.

  • Capital Markets Strategy: Define and execute the roadmap for products like structured products, ETFs, and potential exchange listings

  • Strategic Partnerships: Develop and close relationships with asset managers, investment banks, market makers, and grayscale-type product sponsors.

  • Liquidity & Trading Infrastructure: Engage with liquidity providers, exchanges, and market makers to ensure deep, compliant, and efficient markets for Sentient.

  • Regulatory & Policy Engagement: Build trusted relationships with regulators, policy groups, and industry bodies to shape Sentient’s credibility in institutional markets.

  • Cross-functional Leadership: Partner with product, engineering, and ecosystem teams to ensure institutional needs are integrated into design and delivery.

  • Thought Leadership: Represent Sentient in global capital markets and institutional AI + blockchain forums, shaping the narrative of decentralized AGI adoption.

Requirements

  1. 7+ years in capital markets or investment banking with senior leadership exposure (e.g., Goldman Sachs, bulge-bracket IB, top-tier asset manager, or hedge fund).

  2. Proven track record in raising institutional capital and structuring innovative financial products.

  3. Network across financial institutions, allocators, market makers, and regulatory circles.

  4. Understanding of trading systems, market structure, and regulatory frameworks.

  5. Crypto-native mindset and demonstrated experience bridging TradFi with blockchain.

  6. Excellent negotiation, communication, and leadership skills.

jobs.title: VP of Finance and Strategic Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient
We are building an open-source platform for Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) that empowers developers, creators, and communities to build, align, and own Loyal AI. Backed by Founders Fund, Pantera, and Framework, Sentient is at the forefront of enabling open-source AI.

Role Overview

We are seeking a VP of Finance and Strategic Operations to join our leadership team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in scaling Sentient’s operations and shaping the financial and strategic direction of the company. Reporting directly to one of the co-founders, you will work cross-functionally with leadership across product, business development, and operations to evaluate new initiatives, manage financial planning, and ensure seamless execution across our global organization.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Finance

  • Build and manage financial models for commercial partnerships, token economics, and new AI product initiatives.

  • Prepare internal memos, board materials, and analyses to support strategic decision-making.

  • Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) and recommend optimizations to drive ecosystem growth and sustainability.

Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)

  • Oversee outsourced accounting functions and maintain dynamic financial forecast models.

  • Lead annual budgeting, cash flow management, and treasury operations across multi-signature wallets, on-chain accounts, and off-chain entities.

  • Provide insights and reporting to leadership and investors on financial performance and projections.

Operations & Foundation Support

  • Partner on entity structuring, capital flows, and payment processes with ecosystem partners.

  • Manage fund disbursements, grants programs, and governance protocols for the Sentient Foundation.

  • Identify and implement improvements to financial and operational systems to enhance efficiency, transparency, and compliance.

Risk & Viability Assessment

  • Evaluate the financial viability and commercial risks of AI and blockchain initiatives.

  • Develop pricing strategies, deal structures, and ecosystem economic models to support long-term growth.

Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Act as a bridge between Finance, Product, Business Operations, and Go-to-Market teams.

  • Solve complex cross-functional challenges and drive measurable outcomes that align with Sentient’s mission and strategic roadmap.

Qualifications

  • 5–8 years of experience in investment banking, strategic finance, corporate development, venture finance, or startup operations.

  • Advanced financial modeling skills (Excel/Google Sheets proficiency required; familiarity with Python or data tools a plus).

  • Deep understanding of blockchain, AI, and financial systems — including tokenomics, treasury management, and risk analysis.

  • Proven ability to navigate novel, cross-functional challenges and deliver results in fast-paced, lean environments.

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to balance tactical execution with strategic insight.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a quantitative field; advanced degree or CFA designation preferred.

 - Provide insights and reporting to leadership and investors on financial performance and projections.

Operations & Foundation Support

 - Partner on entity structuring, capital flows, and payment processes with ecosystem partners.

 - Manage fund disbursements, grants programs, and governance protocols for the Sentient Foundation.

 - Identify and implement improvements to financial and operational systems to enhance efficiency, transparency, and compliance.

Risk & Viability Assessment

 - Evaluate the financial viability and commercial risks of AI and blockchain initiatives.

 - Develop pricing strategies, deal structures, and ecosystem economic models to support long-term growth.

Cross-Functional Leadership

 - Act as a bridge between Finance, Product, Business Operations, and Go-to-Market teams.

 - Solve complex cross-functional challenges and drive measurable outcomes that align with Sentient’s mission and strategic roadmap.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - 5–8 years of experience in investment banking, strategic finance, corporate development, venture finance, or startup operations.

 - Advanced financial modeling skills (Excel/Google Sheets proficiency required; familiarity with Python or data tools a plus).

 - Deep understanding of blockchain, AI, and financial systems — including tokenomics, treasury management, and risk analysis.

 - Proven ability to navigate novel, cross-functional challenges and deliver results in fast-paced, lean environments.

 - Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to balance tactical execution with strategic insight.

 - Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a quantitative field; advanced degree or CFA designation preferred.

jobs.title: Director of Events and Community
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sentient

Sentient is building an open-source AGI ecosystem where intelligence, data, and compute operate on decentralized infrastructure with transparent incentives. Backed by top-tier investors including Founders Fund, Pantera, and Framework, Sentient’s mission is to create a community-owned, trust-free foundation for the next era of AI. Through the Sentient Foundation, we connect researchers, founders, and institutions across AI and open-source communities — curating global events and partnerships that advance verifiable, collaborative intelligence.

About the Role

We’re seeking a strategic and experienced Director of Events and Community to lead Sentient’s global event initiatives — from large-scale conferences and academic symposiums to executive gatherings and developer summits. You’ll help establish Sentient’s presence as the premier open-source AI ecosystem, designing events that attract global thought leaders, researchers, and innovators. This role requires an exceptional operator — someone who can take an event from 0 to 1, managing every aspect from strategy and branding to production and execution. You should bring creativity, structure, and an existing Rolodex of top speakers and partners from the tech and AI world.

Responsibilities

  • Own the Open Source AGI Conference: Lead all aspects of planning and execution — including programming, operations, sponsorships, marketing, and logistics.

  • 0-to-1 Execution: Design, structure, and launch new event formats — from ideation through post-event reporting — including venue selection, content programming, sponsorships, and logistics.

  • Program Curation: Leverage your speaker and partner network to secure high-impact participants — from AI researchers to founders and policymakers.

  • Operational Excellence: Build scalable processes for event intake, vendor management, production, and budget tracking.

  • Creative Direction: Collaborate with brand, design, and marketing teams to create experiences that reflect Sentient’s mission of open collaboration and technical excellence.

  • Partnership Management: Work with universities, institutions, and tech partners to co-host events and thought-leadership initiatives.

  • Measurement & Insights: Develop metrics for success, collect feedback, and produce post-event summaries with actionable insights for future events.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Align event strategies with Sentient Labs, Foundation, and Ecosystem teams to support broader organizational goals.

Qualifications

  • 6–10 years of experience in tech event management, ideally within AI, research, or innovation-driven environments.

  • Proven 0-to-1 conference-building experience — capable of creating large-scale events from scratch with minimal guidance.

  • Strong existing speaker Rolodex across AI, academia, and technology.

  • Exceptional project management and organizational skills; comfortable managing multiple concurrent events.

  • Demonstrated ability to manage budgets, vendors, and end-to-end production.

  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills across diverse stakeholder groups.

  • Highly proactive, detail-oriented, and creative, with a strong sense of brand and experience design.

  • Proficiency with tools such as Notion, Google Workspace, AirTable, and event management platforms (Swoogo, Splash, Cvent).

  • Willingness to travel globally (up to 25%) for major events and summits.

Nice to Have

  • Background in AI, deep-tech, or research-driven organizations.

  • Experience curating speaker lineups for technical or thought-leadership conferences.

  • Familiarity with sponsorship development, partner engagement, and community-building.

  • Prior experience managing hybrid or international events.
